fields.summary: Attaching EBS volumes does not work if NCs are registered using hostnames
fields.environment:
CLC, Walrus, CC and SC installed on a single machine.
Two NCs installed on different machines. Networking is configured equally on all nodes to "SYSTEM" mode.

Host name resolution works properly on all 3 machines and they are all connected to the same ethernet network - no firewalls.

comments.body:
Thanks for filing this ticket, we will take this forward in the next community bug scrub, next week, more to come on this very soon.

Please do let us know if you have any questions.

Shashi, can you take a look at this one?  Current recommendations/documentation state that IPs should be used.  If we want to support the use of hostnames for NCs then there are other things to take into consideration, and this will require additional eng work to develop which is not currently on the roadmap.  Since this is not a bug, per se, we'd like you to review this one and determine the relative priority of this in our feature backlog.  

Thanks.

Where is the current recommendations/documentation state available? The current documentation tells nothing about this state: http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.1/ag/add_nodes.html#add_nodes

And btw. which data center still does not use hostnames but IP addresses?

I have to agree with [~kleini] here.  The VMware doc he references is certainly not clear on this (it actually suggests "node NAME").  Anyway, this is a bug, in one of two ways:

1) In my opinion, any issue where a system's hostname cannot be input instead of its IP is a bug, plain and simple.  You can resolve it to an IP before you save it in the DB or config if you think that's really wise, but you should still accept a hostname and do something sane.

2) If you disagree that this issue in a bug as described in #1, then it is a bug because we don't validate that the value given was an IP address.  If we have no intent to support hostnames here, then the CLI should raise an error when one is given.

I'll need someone's help to identify the appropriate reference in the docs.  We discussed this in the bug scrub and this was the consensus within Development.  

That said, option 2 is something we plan to do in the near term as a stop-gap.

All, so this specific ticket has to do with an issue which is not /really/ because a host name was used.  I explain further below, but suggest that the conversation about how the system handles {{registration}} using host names be handled in a new ticket.  I've created one here EUCA-4647.

Also, I think that Dan's summary is accurate except in that it is group membership bootstrap (and not HA) which does require IP addresses to work correctly in its current form.

Now, looking at the problem problem in /this/ ticket, there are two issues:
# serviceTag lookup fails on CLC which should be resolving the hostname to canonicalize the serviceTag
# CC does not allow for sufficiently long service URLs; currently 64, should be at least 291.

Please see {{dev/grze/EUCA-4348}} for some working patches.


* [~nurmi] or [~juphoff] Could you see if the buffer size changes I identified are complete?
c533835 Fixes EUCA-4348 allocate buffer suitable for any kind of URL including full-length DNS names

* [~clc-team] Could you see the following 2 commits
df1921a Fixes EUCA-4348 do host name resolution when checking service tags
cd24f31 Fixes EUCA-4348 safely adjust the storage type for the serviceTag to allow for the required 291 characters

* [~viglesias] The above fix should upgrade cleanly (I tried), but would need to be verified.

NODE	abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.abcdefghijklmnopqrst	CC_137	i-839D42D3

# 3. Call attach volume (works!)

# 4. Volume gets attached

ATTACHMENT	vol-B6C74002	i-839D42D3	/dev/sdc	attached	2013-01-03T02:03:23.688Z

[root@eucahost-51-137 clc]# ssh -i ~/grze.priv root@192.168.40.91 ls -l /dev/disk/by-path/*virtio[^-1]* 
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 9 Jan  3 02:03 /dev/disk/by-path/pci-0000:00:07.0-virtio-pci-virtio4 -> ../../vdb

Chris put this back yesterday.  This needs to go through QA.

I've tested at 112 characters (111 plus the .) and its working.

Next I will try 255(254 characters plus the .) as per http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1035.txt which states the maximum FQDN as 255.
